comment.author: 32573662@N00
comment._content: A story in the Times on May 12 1946, titled "Fremont: A District That Thrives" mentions that in the early days, "The present intersection of Fremont Avenue and Fremont Place was a swamp with the sign advertising Denny and Hoyt's Addition in the middle of it!" Perhaps this is the sign in question.

comment.realname: University of Washington Libraries Digital Collections
comment.author: 8337233@N06
comment._content: Yes, perhaps it is! Great little tidbit to add. Thanks.
